definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss

sentences.english: You can't expect the "talent" to travel to the back end of nowhere, I suppose.
sentences.chinese: 我们似乎不能认为这个“天才”讲得都是无稽之谈。

sentences.english: Talk of him leaving in the summer is just mischief-making.
sentences.chinese: 说他夏天离开的传闻只是无稽之谈。

sentences.english: Bll of it, astronomers say, is bunk.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家们说，所有这些都是无稽之谈。

sentences.english: If that sounds like something out of a far-fetched Star Trek episode, think again.
sentences.chinese: 如果你觉得这听起来像是无稽之谈，再想想看。
转世轮回是确有其事还是无稽之谈？

sentences.english: The finding debunks the myth that male students are more intelligent.
sentences.chinese: 这项发现证明了男学生更聪明的说法纯属无稽之谈。

sentences.english: At the same time the official science still insists that psychotronic is mere charlatanry.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时官方科学仍然坚称精神电子是无稽之谈。

sentences.english: He said most of my theory is eyewash.
sentences.chinese: 他说我的理论大多数是无稽之谈。

sentences.english: I've never heard such a load of cobblers in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一生中还没有听到过这种无稽之谈。

sentences.english: You don't really expect me to buy that cock-and-bull story, do you?
sentences.chinese: 你不会真的以为我会相信那种无稽之谈吧？

sentences.english: We now recognize the above-mentioned statements — yesterday’s common sense — as nonsense (Stanovich, 2007).
sentences.chinese: 我们现在认识到了上述说法纯粹是无稽之谈。

sentences.english: It is nonsense when people say they are paying respect to this or that predecessor." Jiang says.
sentences.chinese: 有的导演说要像哪位前辈致敬，这简直是无稽之谈”。

sentences.english: If you try similar word-for-word translations, you too could end up with nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 如果你进行类似的逐字翻译，也会最终成为无稽之谈。

definition: lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
